intro: Diploon venezuelana, commonly known as the Venezuelan diploon, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in wetland or marshy areas. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental value.
